response.message: An excellent post if I should say so myself.  Great job!
Haven't you mixed up the legend colors in the "Job Application Over Time" diagram? It would make more sense if application via profile would be more popular now (i.e. should be blue).
Sorry, no mix up (should have read more closely before submitting :)
Wow!  This is an excellent and thought-provoking piece, Dennis.  Something, somewhere inside if me has always understood this and this post kinda' brings it all together... Thanks!

I have an interesting UX problem with the submittion process - I start the application but I just want to quit in the middle - I didn't see an obvious way(close/exit button or keyboard's Esc) to do that.

I have always used Google Analytics to analyse how a user navigates through my website, then after being able to improve navigation and how a user can access certain content (amongst other things). I noticed you mentioned another tool called KissMetrics; what does this bring to the table that Google Analytics doesn't? Thanks Demis

Great post.
but i have a question , why you want to host the CVs at a 3rd party?
why not host the CVs at your site? and then the viewer can be created by converting the doc or pdf to swf (flash) and displaying it using flash (something like FlashPaper)
i think this method wont have the latency problem.
just wondering :)

So... what was the end result of your research?
How are you handling viewing the CV's?
@Karim KissMetrics allows us to do in-app specific metrics, i.e. important Customer Actions we want to record independently - Google analytics provides the general traffic overview of the site.

#Demis Thanks for your reply. but i think you misuderstood my question.
i was asking why you didn't implement the document viewer by hand instead of using outside solutions like "Google Docs", "Zoho Viewer" and Scribd?
this can be done by converting the uploaded document to pdf and then converting the pdf to a flash viewer.
i think the pluses of implementing this solution by hand is that you can control the performance and latency instead of being dependant on a 3rd party.

Letting the job seeker post their own CV, means your clients don’t need to have a system on their website for anyone to apply for a job, as they can just link to the advert you are hosting.

Should you allow all employers to put free adverts up that are only seen if accessed by a direct link.  Then employers will be able to use you for the work flow for ALL jobs including jobs they don’t wish to pay to advertise with you.

Apologies @Karim my answer was for @Nathan :)

Basically because we didn't trust the conversion tools to do a great job with the various formats and layouts of CVs we receive. We simply preferred to outsource the conversion/viewing to companies that specialize and build their business models around online document conversions / viewers.
